description: Section 508 Accessibility Guidelines for AI Prompt Output
source: Section 508 of the Rehabilitation Act (29 U.S.C. ยง 794d)

images: Include descriptive alt text for all images
Describe the content and function of images, not just their appearance
For complex images (charts, diagrams), provide extended descriptions
Use empty alt text (alt='') for purely decorative images
multimedia: Provide captions for all audio content
Include transcripts for video and audio content
Ensure audio descriptions are available for visual content
Support keyboard-only navigation for video players
documents: Use proper heading structure (H1, H2, H3, etc.)
Provide document structure with semantic markup
Include table headers for data tables
Ensure sufficient color contrast (WCAG 2.1 AA: 4.5:1 for text)
Don't rely on color alone to convey information
links: Use descriptive link text (avoid 'click here' or 'read more')
Indicate link purpose from link text alone
forms: Provide clear instructions and error messages
Use fieldsets and legends for grouped controls
language: Use plain language (target 8th grade reading level)
Define technical terms and acronyms on first use
Keep sentences concise (20 words or fewer when possible)
Use common words instead of jargon
structure: Organize content logically with clear headings

output_instructions.default: When generating content, ensure it follows accessibility best practices: use proper heading structure, provide alt text for images, use descriptive links, and write in plain language.
output_instructions.images: For any images in the output, provide detailed alt text descriptions that convey the content and function, not just visual appearance.
output_instructions.data_viz: For charts and data visualizations, provide both visual representation and text-based data tables or descriptions.
output_instructions.code: For code snippets, include comments explaining functionality and ensure proper semantic markup if presented in documentation.
output_instructions.interactive: For interactive elements, ensure keyboard accessibility and provide clear instructions for all input methods.

common_violations.solution: Add specific instruction to include detailed alt text
Request plain language or definitions for technical terms
Specify WCAG AA color contrast requirements
